title: Joanie 4 Jackie
brief_description: In 1995 Miranda July dropped out of college, moved to Portland, Oregon, and typed up a pamphlet that she imagined would be the start of a revolution of girls and women making movies and sharing them with each other. The pamphlet said: “A challenge and a promise: Lady, you send me your movie and I’ll send you the latest Big Miss Moviola Chainletter Tape.” The Joanie 4 Jackie project involved zines, chainletter tapes, co-star tapes and events.

constellations_other.name: Teens, zines and 90s scenes
constellations_other.description: Exploring representations of teen life and culture.
